summary: This is an invitation from ECPAT-USA for a virtual discussion about the Netflix docuseries 'Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich.' The event features a panel including the director, a psychologist, and a board member, and is moderated by ECPAT-USA's Executive Director. It frames the discussion around survivor stories and Epstein's use of wealth and power to carry out abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Convicted sex offender, subject of discussion
persons.context: The central subject of the event and the Netflix docuseries 'Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich.' Described as using his wealth and power to carry out sexual abuse.

persons.name: Lisa Bryant
persons.context: Featured as a panelist for the discussion, identified as the director (presumably of the docuseries 'Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich').

persons.name: Kathryn Stamoulis
persons.context: Featured as a panelist for the discussion, identified as a psychologist.

persons.name: Fernando Camacho
persons.context: Featured as a panelist for the discussion, identified as an ECPAT-USA Board Member with the honorific 'Hon.'

persons.name: Lori L. Cohen
persons.context: Moderating the panel discussion, identified as the Executive Director of ECPAT-USA.

connections.description: Lisa Bryant is the director of the docuseries 'Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich,' which examines Epstein's crimes.
Both are associated with ECPAT-USA; Camacho is a board member and Cohen is the Executive Director.
Stamoulis, as a psychologist, is participating in a discussion analyzing Epstein's abuses.

events.title: ECPAT-USA Discussion on Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich
events.description: A virtual panel discussion via Zoom about the Netflix docuseries 'Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich,' featuring director Lisa Bryant, psychologist Kathryn Stamoulis, and board member Fernando Camacho, moderated by Lori L. Cohen.

keyFacts: The document is an invitation to a public discussion hosted by the anti-trafficking organization ECPAT-USA.
The discussion centers on the Netflix docuseries 'Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich' and frames Epstein's crimes as the use of 'wealth and power' to carry out sexual abuse.
The event features professional analysis from a director, a psychologist, and a legal/policy figure (a board member with the honorific 'Hon.').
The invitation explicitly states that 'Stories from survivors fuel this docuseries,' highlighting the survivor-centric focus of the discussion.
The document itself is not a legal or investigative record but promotional material for an advocacy and awareness event.
